section.section:
On refusal to renew, suspension, or revocation of an insurer's certificate of authority, the Commissioner immediately shall notify:
the insurer; and
each insurance producer of the insurer in the state of record in the office of the Commissioner.
The refusal to renew, revocation, or suspension of a certificate of authority automatically suspends or revokes the appointment of each insurance producer of the insurer in the State.
The Commissioner shall state in the notice to each insurance producer under paragraph (1) of this subsection that the appointment of the insurance producer has been suspended or revoked.
The Commissioner may publish notice of the revocation of a certificate of authority in a newspaper published in the State.

text.section:
Instead of or in addition to suspending or revoking a certificate of authority, the Commissioner may:
impose on the holder a penalty of not less than $100 but not more than $125,000 for each violation of this article; and
require the holder to make restitution to any person who has suffered financial injury because of the violation of this article.

The Commissioner shall adopt regulations to:
establish standards for the imposition of a penalty under subsection (d) of this section; and
carry out the provisions of subsection (b)(11) of this section.
